thread.title: Mariah Carey ‘I Don’t video: Singer takes aim at Packer in new music video
thread.title_full: Mariah Carey ‘I Don’t video: Singer takes aim at Packer in new music video

author: Natalie Wolfe
title: Mariah Carey ‘I Don’t video: Singer takes aim at Packer in new music video
text:
IF THERE was a scene to describe the way James Packer and Mariah Carey’s engagement ended, it’s in the singer’s new video ‘I Don’t’. 
Carey, who was engaged to the billionaire businessman until November last year used her new music video with rapper YG as a public therapy session which saw her burning a wedding dress and giving the camera (or Packer) the finger.
The music video starts tame with Carey walking towards the camera decked out in a tule-heavy wedding dress and veil.
Alluding to a different life with Packer. Source: YouTube 
The rest of the video mainly features the pop diva rolling around on top of a car in white lingerie and a lacy garter or a black PVC leotard.
Most of Carey’s new video ‘I Don’t’ is scenes like this. Source: YouTube 
Lyrics like “Boy I was buggin’/ Thinkin’ somehow I can trust ya/ But you don’t mean nothing/ ‘Cause I don’t, I don’t” hint at what might’ve went on behind their heavily publicised relationship but it’s a scene from the video that speaks a thousand words — specifically the scene of Mariah burning a puffy wedding dress to ashes.
Throwing the dress on the fire. Source: YouTube 
Carey leaves her wedding dress burning. Source: YouTube 
While the video might feature Mariah throwing her wedding dress on top of the fire, her engagement ring, valued at more than $10 million USD, didn’t suffer the same fate.
The video even features Carey giving the camera the rude finger with, you guessed it, the gigantic sparkler sitting on her middle finger.
Carey’s engagement ring was front and centre in her new music video. Source: YouTube 
The new single ‘I Don’t’ came after fans waited patiently for the pop diva to release new music and boy did she deliver.
In her docu-series Mariah’s World , the singer revealed she wrote the song “to heal.”
After recording in the studio, the final episode ends with Carey taking off the huge diamond and leaving it on the music stand.
Most would realise there’s a discrepancy in the timeline considering Carey ‘left’ the ring in the last episode of her show but is seen wearing it in the music video.
It’s still unclear whether ‘I Don’t’ and her single from last year ‘Infinity’ are the start of a new album.
Carey’s last album Me. I am Mariah ... The Elusive Chanteuse was the singer’s 14th and most recent and was released in 2014.
Mariah is set to tour with Lionel Richie for their All The Hits Tour this year.

Watch the entire video below.
